name: base64-encoder
title: Base64 File Encoder
description: Encode files to Base64 strings for data transfer and embedding
content:
Overview

This application encodes any file into a Base64 string format. Base64 encoding is commonly used for embedding binary data in text formats, transferring files over text-based protocols, and data serialization.

Features

  • Encode any file type to Base64 format
  • Automatic size calculation and comparison
  • No external dependencies required (uses Python stdlib)
  • Output saved as .b64 file

Parameters

  • Input File: Upload any file from stash
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for encoded file

Output

The application generates a file named {filename}.b64 containing the Base64-encoded content of the input file.

Use Cases

  • Embed binary files in JSON or XML documents
  • Transfer files over text-only protocols
  • Store binary data in databases or configuration files
  • Email attachments and data URIs
command: REPO_DIR="prod_apps_${RANDOM}_${RANDOM}"; rm -rf "$REPO_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true; git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git "$REPO_DIR" && python "$REPO_DIR/python/base64_encoder.py" "${inputFile}" -o "${outputDir}"
